name: CFC-11 measurement
datasetName: CFC-11 expected and measured rate of change (Montzka et al. 2018)

source.name: CFC-11 expected and measured rate of change (Montzka et al. 2018)
source.dataPublishedBy: Montzka, S. A., Dutton, G. S., Yu, P., Ray, E., Portmann, R. W., Daniel, J. S., ... & Nance, J. D. (2018). An unexpected and persistent increase in global emissions of ozone-depleting CFC-11. Nature, 557(7705), 413.
source.additionalInfo:
Data denotes the measured annual change in concentrations of trichlorofluoromethane (CFC-11) gas as the global average, collected via air collection and analysis automated onsite instrumentation with gas chromatography coupled with electron capture detection (GCâ€“ECD). Data here represents the annual average for data reported in Montzka et al. (2018).

The WMO (2003; 2010 and 2014) projections are those published by the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) and represent the global average expected rate of change in CFC-11 concentrations based on reported emissions of CFC-11 from all parties to the Montreal Protocol.
